department.dept_long_name: Committee on Degrees in Social Studies

course.title: Health Care in America
course.description: This course explores the social and cultural politics of healthcare in America, highlighting the ways in which "American Exceptionalism" has resulted in high costs, poor outcomes, and disparate access to care. We will discuss several case studies of controversy related to issues of cost, access, and equity, exploring how such issues have influenced strategies for reform. We will also compare the American healthcare system to systems in other industrialized nations.
